medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 20 hours prior to presentation, with persistent abdominal cramping, bloating, and failure to pass flatus or stool following a routine screening colonoscopy performed the previous day. The pain is mainly focused in the right lower quadrant (RLQ). Mild nausea was present, no vomiting reported, and fever reached 102Â°F with chills and sweats. The patient has not eaten since the colonoscopy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient has a history of prior traumatic splenectomy. Previous treatment for Lyme disease, though unsure if the true diagnosis was made. Healing bump on the left buttock that felt like a boil.
